ImageData.LabelName: Cancer has spread to multiple places in one or more organs not near the lung:

OriginalSource.Creator: Terese Winslow
OriginalSource.Comment: Made figure an older adult, updated skin tone to FP II, and added more facial features
Changed the label “Primary tumor” in the main figure to “Primary cancer” so that it matches the label in the inset
Revisions made to image per AJCC 8th edition staging
Removed "Cancer in the" from "Cancer in the other lung" label

Removed lines connecting the inset box to the primary tumor on the main figure; shaded in the area connecting the primary tumor in the inset box to the primary tumor on the main figure; labeled the "Lung" in which the primary tumor resides; changed the label on the other side to say “Cancer in other lung”
Changed title to say Stage IV Lung Cancer
Moved the inset box down so that it isn’t so close to the Stage IV title; changed label in box to say “Metastatic cancer” and changed label on the main illustration to say “Cancer in both lungs”
Replaced metastasis inset with a new inset from the Metastasis image
Removed the inset showing the fluid in the lung lining; made the adrenal glands stand out.

Diagnoses.Diagnosis: stage IVB non-small cell lung cancer

ContentDescriptions.ContentDescription: Stage IVB lung cancer; drawing shows a primary cancer in the right lung and other parts of the body where lung cancer may spread, including the brain, adrenal gland, kidney, liver, distant lymph nodes, and bone. An inset shows cancer cells spreading from the lung, through the blood and lymph system, to another part of the body where metastatic cancer has formed.

Stage IVB lung cancer; drawing shows a primary cancer in the right lung and other parts of the body where lung cancer may spread, including the brain, adrenal gland, kidney, liver, distant lymph nodes, and bone. An inset shows cancer cells spreading from the lung, through the blood and lymph system, to another part of the body where metastatic cancer has formed.

Captions.MediaCaption: Stage IVB lung cancer. The cancer has spread to multiple places in one or more organs that are not near the lung, such as the brain, adrenal gland, kidney, liver, distant lymph nodes, or bone.
Stage IVB lung cancer. The cancer has spread to multiple places in one or more organs that are not near the lung, such as the brain, adrenal gland, kidney, liver, distant lymph nodes, or bone.

ProposedUse.Glossary: stage IV non-small cell lung cancer

ProcessingStatus.Comment: Added Supp Info Doc for revisions to stage IV.
